docs.title: GhostStorm
docs.text:
AI-Powered Web Automation Platform

GhostStorm is a comprehensive automation platform for web tasks across multiple platforms including TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and DEXTools.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Multi-Platform Support: TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, DEXTools, and more
  • AI-Powered Automation: LLM integration for intelligent flow generation
  • Flow Recording: Record and replay browser interactions
  • Proxy Management: Auto-rotation with premium provider support
  • Real-Time Dashboard: WebSocket-powered monitoring
  • Checkpoint System: Resume flows from any point
  • Docker Support: Easy containerized deployment

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# Install
git clone https://github.com/devbyteai/ghoststorm.git
cd ghoststorm
uv sync --all-extras --dev

# Run
make dev

Open http://localhost:8000 to access the dashboard.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
• Quick Start - Get running in 5 minutes
  • Architecture - System design and components
  • API Reference - REST and WebSocket API
  • Contributing - How to contribute

docs.title: License
docs.text: MIT License - See LICENSE

docs.title: REST API
docs.text: Base URL: http://localhost:8000/api

docs.title: Tasks
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description GET /tasks List all tasks POST /tasks Create a task GET /tasks/{id} Get task details DELETE /tasks/{id} Delete a task POST /tasks/{id}/retry Retry a task

docs.title: Flows
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description GET /flows List all flows POST /flows Create a flow GET /flows/{id} Get flow details POST /flows/{id}/execute Execute a flow POST /flows/record/start Start recording POST /flows/record/stop Stop recording

docs.title: Proxies
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description GET /proxies List proxies POST /proxies/scrape Scrape proxies POST /proxies/test Test proxies

docs.title: LLM
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description GET /llm/providers List providers POST /llm/complete Get completion GET /llm/models List models

docs.title: WebSocket API
docs.text: Connect to ws://localhost:8000/ws

docs.title: Events
docs.text: Event Description task:created New task created task:started Task execution started task:progress Task progress update task:completed Task completed task:failed Task failed

docs.title: Message Format
docs.text:
{
  "type": "task:progress",
  "data": {
    "task_id": "uuid",
    "progress": 50,
    "message": "Processing..."
  }
}

docs.title: 1. Engine (src/ghoststorm/engine/)
docs.text:
The orchestration layer managing task execution:

  • Orchestrator: Coordinates browser instances and task queues
  • Task Manager: Handles task lifecycle (create, execute, retry)
  • Flow Engine: Executes recorded automation flows
  • Checkpoint System: Enables flow resumption and branching

docs.title: 2. Browser (src/ghoststorm/browser/)
docs.text:
Browser automation layer:

  • BrowserPool: Manages browser instance lifecycle
  • PageController: Handles page navigation and interactions
  • Stealth: Anti-detection measures (fingerprinting, headers)
  • Recorder: Captures user actions for flow creation

docs.title: 3. Assistant (src/ghoststorm/assistant/)
docs.text:
AI-powered automation assistant:

  • Chat Interface: Natural language task creation
  • Flow Generator: LLM-generated automation scripts
  • Code Executor: Sandboxed execution of generated code
  • Docker Integration: Isolated execution environments

docs.title: 4. LLM (src/ghoststorm/llm/)
docs.text:
Language model integrations:

  • Providers: Ollama, OpenAI, Anthropic adapters
  • Streaming: Real-time response streaming
  • Context Management: Conversation history and memory

docs.title: 5. Proxy (src/ghoststorm/proxy/)
docs.text:
Proxy management system:

  • Pool Manager: Proxy rotation and health checking
  • Scrapers: Auto-discovery from public sources
  • Premium Providers: Integration with paid services
  • Validation: Proxy testing and scoring

docs.title: 6. API (src/ghoststorm/api/)
docs.text:
REST and WebSocket API:

  • Routes: RESTful endpoints for all operations
  • WebSocket: Real-time task updates and events
  • Authentication: API key and session management

docs.title: 7. Web (src/ghoststorm/web/)
docs.text:
React dashboard:

  • Pages: Tasks, Flows, Proxies, Settings, etc.
  • Components: Reusable UI elements
  • State: Real-time updates via WebSocket

docs.title: Task Execution
docs.text:
1. User creates task (UI/API)
        │
        ▼
2. Task queued in Orchestrator
        │
        ▼
3. Browser instance acquired from pool
        │
        ▼
4. Proxy assigned from pool
        │
        ▼
5. Flow executed with checkpoints
        │
        ▼
6. Results streamed via WebSocket
        │
        ▼
7. Browser/proxy returned to pools

docs.title: Flow Recording
docs.text:
1. User initiates recording
        │
        ▼
2. Browser launched with recorder
        │
        ▼
3. Actions captured (clicks, inputs, navigation)
        │
        ▼
4. LLM analyzes and optimizes flow
        │
        ▼
5. Checkpoints auto-inserted
        │
        ▼
6. Flow saved to library

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
config/
├── platforms/          # Platform-specific configs
│   ├── tiktok.json
│   ├── instagram.json
│   └── dextools.json
├── browser/           # Browser settings
├── proxy/             # Proxy provider configs
└── llm/               # LLM provider settings

docs.title: Testing Strategy
docs.text:
tests/
├── unit/              # Isolated component tests
├── integration/       # Service integration tests
├── e2e/              # Full system tests
│   ├── api/          # API endpoint tests
│   ├── ui/           # Playwright UI tests
│   └── journeys/     # Full workflow tests
└── conftest.py       # Shared fixtures

docs.title: Docker
docs.text: docker compose up -d

docs.title: Manual
docs.text:
uv sync --all-extras
uv run ghoststorm run

docs.title: Performance Considerations
docs.text:
• Connection Pooling: Database and proxy connections pooled
  • Async I/O: All I/O operations are async
  • Browser Reuse: Browsers recycled between tasks
  • Streaming: Large responses streamed to minimize memory

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: See the main CONTRIBUTING.md in the repository root.

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get GhostStorm running in 5 minutes.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.11+
  • uv package manager
  • Node.js 18+ (for web dashboard)

docs.title: Option 1: From Source
docs.text:
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/devbyteai/ghoststorm.git
cd ghoststorm

# Install dependencies
uv sync --all-extras --dev

# Run
uv run ghoststorm run

docs.title: Option 2: Docker
docs.text: docker compose up -d

docs.title: Option 3: pip
docs.text:
pip install ghoststorm
ghoststorm run

docs.title: First Run
docs.text:
1. Start the server: 

    make dev
# or
uv run ghoststorm run --dev

  2. Open dashboard: http://localhost:8000

  3. Create your first task:

  4. Enter a URL in the task input
  5. Platform is auto-detected

  6. Click "Create Task"

  7. Monitor progress:

  8. Real-time updates in the dashboard
  9. WebSocket connection shows status

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
# .env file
GHOSTSTORM_HOST=0.0.0.0
GHOSTSTORM_PORT=8000
GHOSTSTORM_DEBUG=true

# LLM (optional)
OLLAMA_URL=http://localhost:11434
OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-...

# Proxies (optional)
PROXY_PREMIUM_KEY=...

docs.title: Config Files
docs.text:
config/
├── browser.json      # Browser settings
├── proxy.json        # Proxy configuration
└── platforms/        # Platform-specific settings

docs.title: Record a Flow
docs.text:
1. Click "Record Flow" in dashboard
  2. Interact with the browser
  3. Actions are captured automatically
  4. Click "Stop" when done
  5. Flow is saved to library

docs.title: Execute a Flow
docs.text:
1. Go to Flows page
  2. Select a flow
  3. Click "Execute"
  4. Configure instances and proxy settings
  5. Monitor execution

docs.title: Manage Proxies
docs.text:
1. Go to Proxies page
  2. Click "Scrape" to find free proxies
  3. Or add premium provider credentials
  4. Proxies are auto-validated

docs.title: CLI Commands
docs.text:
# Start server
ghoststorm run [--port 8000] [--dev]

# Run task
ghoststorm task run <url>

# Execute flow
ghoststorm flow execute <flow-id>

# Scrape proxies
ghoststorm proxy scrape

# Health check
ghoststorm health

docs.title: Browser not launching
docs.text:
# Install browser dependencies
uv run patchright install chromium

docs.title: Proxy errors
docs.text:
• Check proxy format: protocol://user:pass@host:port
  • Validate proxies: Proxies page → Test All

docs.title: LLM not responding
docs.text:
• Ensure Ollama is running: ollama serve
  • Or set OpenAI API key in settings
